alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Knox; Posey (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 10 at 11:54AM EDT until April 12 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... White River at Petersburg and Hazleton. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Illinois... Wabash River at Mount Carmel. .Minor flooding of lowland areas continues on the White River at both Petersburg and Hazleton...and on the Wabash River at Mount Carmel. Both rivers have crested and will continue to fall through this week amid dry weather. Flooding is expected to end on the Wabash River at Mount Carmel Tuesday....while ending on the White River at Petersburg late Wednesday...and at Hazleton Friday. Minor flooding primarily impacts local river roads, parks, and agricultural land. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Mount Carmel. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, River is bankfull in all locations. All oil field production ceases with the exception of pumping units on substructures. Access to these are by boat only. Agricultural losses increase dramatically. Farmers move livestock to higher ground. City of Mount Carmel leaves flood gates B and C in year round. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Monday /11:00 AM EDT Monday/ the stage was 19.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM CDT Monday /11:00 AM EDT Monday/ was 20.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.9 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated late this evening.
